page.title: 02COWLING A MOORLAND VILLAGE 2
page.content: In recent years many farm houses have been bought simply as dwellings and the land sold off to bigger farms. Many residents now travel out of the village to work in bigger towns and cities nearby,and there has been a corresponding decrease in the number of shops,which have been affected,too, by the growth of supermarkets locally. In spite of these quite drastic changes Cowling has retained much of the character and appearance it has had for many years,in some cases decades,and is still recognisable as a good example of its kind.Although the village itself is not immediately enhanced by the mills and terraced houses,built originally for the workers, it is surrounded by fields and moorland,with a distinctive crag surmounted by two man- made memorial pinnacles overlooking the area.
